intro: Disa venosa, commonly known as the veined disa, is a striking member of the Orchidaceae family native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, often pink or purple flowers with intricate veining. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are bilaterally symmetrical, with three sepals and three petals, one of which is often modified into a lip. Disa venosa is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
